Summer Hill Films is a U.S. theatrical distributor and worldwide sales company with international and domestic appeal. The company was founded by Ted Chalmers and Jon Bonnell of TomCat Films as a supplemental label to provide the growing need for high quality theatrical and TV product to non-genre buyers.  Chalmers and Bonnell worked together previously at Moving Pictures Film and TV, which became ICAP Media.  The new label will provide a full range of services relating to the sales, marketing, licensing and distribution of mainstream feature films, television and special interest content across all media in the worldwide marketThe company is headed by sales and distribution veteran Ted Chalmers.Ted began his career in 1990 working with Paul Rich at Trans Atlantic Entertainment.  After its sale to Lakeshore, he went on to lead the sales at Creative Light Entertainment and Moving Pictures Film and Television.  He was also Senior VP of Media Brokerage for ICAP Media, a division of ICAP Plc.

TomCat Films LLC was formed in 2007 by a financing entity to produce high concept films for the world market. All of its productions have been profitable to date. It has offices in Phoenix, Arizona and Beverly Hills, California.  Recently released productions include METAL MAN, ALICE IN MURDERLAND and STAR QUEST: THE ODYSSEY.At TomCat Films we specialize in offering highly marketable films for worldwide distribution. We will also utilize state of the art technology to make the experience of buying and delivering films as simple and transparent as possible.  The company attends all major film and TV markets, including AFM, Berlin and Cannes.

Managed assests of Moving Pictures Film and Television, Ltd. ("MPF&TV" or "The Company"), a multi-media company incorporated in Delaware, headquartered in Santa Monica, with offices in Phoenix and New York and additional sales staff located world-wide. It owns the Moving Pictures branded products and a film distribution business. The film distribution business. which became (MPF&TV), was launched during the Tribeca Film Festival in 2006. Since then it has steadily increased its library of films. Within the United States, it releases such films in theaters as "The Legend of Tillamook's Gold" and "Little Big Top", and sells movies like "Think Tank" and "Trainmaster" to DVD distributors and TV stations. Internationally, MPF&TV attends all of the major film and TV markets, where it sells films and TV series and represents other companies' libraries. As of August 2009, MPF&TV represents more than two hundred films and TV series.During the summer of 2008, then-owner Maitland Primrose Group, Inc sold the Moving Pictures brand and assets to ICAP North America, and simultaneously signed an agreement to manage those assets for ICAP North America. MPF&TV stands tall in the ranks of mid-sized international sales organizations, and is growing fast, as a part of ICAP Media Markets. MPF&TV now positions itself as one of the world's leading licensors of film and television content, from kids/family, drama, romantic comedy, action/adventure and horror/thriller to television series and specials, documentaries and animated features and series.
